text: 6:00am on an ALARM CLOCK.  It BUZZES. CREDIT SEQUENCE BEGINS... In bed, under a black-light poster of Zodiac signs portra as sexual positions, KITTLE opens his eyes.  He's dashing handsome, with a bushy moustache and big mutton chops. In the MIRROR ON THE CEILING: Kittle admires himself, the gets up, leaving behind a naked, BEAUTIFUL WOMAN.
You should hit the bricks.

The woman is starting to regret last night. IN THE KITCHEN, Kittle opens the fridge, puts a shrink-wrapped steak on the counter,  A carton of eggs. He lights a burner under a skillet. IN THE BEDROOM, the woman sits up, wraps herself in a she She notices a PICTURE hung crooked on the wall: A PHOTO OF KITTLE in dress blues, fresh from the police academy; a Kittle once clean-cut, crew-cut and untainted. A Kittle long dead. IN THE KITCHEN, Kittle dumps the steak in the skillet.  H cracks eggs as the woman comes to pose in the doorway.
Don't I even get breakfast?
Kittle looks at her, smiles.
No.

6:00am.  An ALARM CLOCK RINGS.  BILLY-BOY's already up, a outsized, scruffy-faced bruiser with mutton chops rivalin Kittle's.  He's lifting weights, naked, covered in sweat, smoking a cigarette. His gun and badge wait in a holster on a chair. Billy-Boy drops the barbells, executing kung-fu moves, poorly.  He chops at imaginary foes as he exits.  A momen later, he crosses back with a six-pack of beer... IN THE BATHROOM, Billy-Boy gets in the shower, guzzling a beer.  He tosses the empty, turns on the water... Blasted by the cold spray, Billy-Boy throws back his head and lets out a long, loud WAR HOOT.

ALARM CLOCK.  6:00am again, as the ALARM BUZZES... In the satin-sheeted bed, a Siamese cat leaps up and rubs against NENA.  Nena rolls over, black and beautiful, straightens her power Afro.  She pets the cat, pushes awa her pillow and picks up her GUN there. IN THE KITCHEN, Nena puts the gun down and fills a coffee pot at the sink.  The cat circles her ankles, purring. Nena opens a can of tuna, dumps it on a plate and puts it the floor.  The cat eats. Nena opens the refrigerator where a photo of Bruce Lee is taped to the door.  She takes out a coffee jar, revealing GUN hidden behind it on the shelf. In a cabinet, she pushes aside another GUN to get a mug. Nena sits at a table to wait for water to boil.  She pick thru a box of electronic bits and pieces, tinkering with MICRO-TRANSMITTER, using a jeweler's eyepiece.  CAMERA MO down... REVEALS a HOLSTER screwed to the underside of tab another GUN within reach. IN THE BEDROOM, Nena enters with coffee.  She kneels cross-legged in a bean-bag chair, lights incense, then sh her eyes and begins her morning meditation with a low hum
At a mirror, Kittle ties his wide tie, combs his moustach His suit is of the finest, loudest plaid.  He straightens the "Whip Inflation Now" BUTTON on his wide lapel.

Kittle strides toward garages behind his building, pointi a remote.  One GARAGE DOOR OPENS slowly. We CANNOT SEE INTO the DARK GARAGE as Kittle disappears inside.  We HEAR a CAR DOOR.  An ENGINE ROARS, RUMBLES, idling... a throaty GURGLE... till Kittle pulls out in hi Ford Gran Torino GT... A small American flag on the antenna flaps in the breeze. The Torino swings onto the street, peeling out... ZOOM IN: as the Torino races away.  FREEZE FRAME. ...CREDIT SEQUENCE ENDS.
Kittle's Torino cruises down Vine past Capital Records. Traffic's light this early... WHIP PAN/ZOOM IN: on the "HOLLYWOOD" sign, distant.
Kids toss firecrackers in the gutter and watch them pop. Red, white and blue decorations are everywhere.
July 4th, 1976

Nena walks down the sidewalk in a leather overcoat, sunglasses and ultra-flair bell-bottoms.  Shop-keepers raising storefront gates greet her.  Men crane their neck to watch her pass, wide-eyed and whistling. In the street, the Torino rounds a corner.  It pulls to t curb to meet Nena.  An elderly DRUNKARD's leering at Nena she climbs in the car.
Right on, Brown Sugar!  How 'bout taking me with you?
Where I'm going today, Old Man, you do not want to go.
As Kittle pulls away, u-turning...

Alfresco greasy-spoon.  Under one R,W+B umbrella, Billy-B in baggy suit and lollipop-orange aviator sunglasses, consumes a burger and looks lovey-eyed at his SCHOOL-MARM girlfriend, who reads a "MATH" text, innocent and petit. Across the street, Kittle's car pulls up, HONKING. Billy-Boy motions he'll be along in a minute.
Nena's reading "Fear of Flying."  Kittle watches Billy-Bo
Look at her and him together.  King Kong and Fay Wray.
Nena glances up, returns to reading.
Whatever.
Billy-Boy gives his girl an apple, kisses her.  Kittle la on the horn.  Billy-Boy runs over with a cup of take-out coffee, carrying a newspaper under his arm.
Why do I always have to sit in back?
It's just the way things are, kiddo.
Well, I would like to sit in front today.
It's not gonna happen.
Fer cryin' out loud, Billy-Boy, just get in the car.  You're way too big a target to be sitting up here.

Billy-Boy gets in, disgruntled, handing the coffee to Nen who passes it to Kittle as the car sets in motion. Billy-Boy turns to look out the back, waving goodbye. Kittle watches thru the rearview mirror.
How's your precious little school-marm today?
She's fine, as if you cared.

Tell me something... what's a school teacher doing having you meet for breakfast in one of the filthiest parts of downtown skank-ville?  I mean, this is not the place for fine dining, unless looking at prostitutes stimulates your appetite.
Filthy kids go to kindergarten too. What are you saying, anyhow?
Nothing, I guess.  Just an observation.  She's really something special.  You're a lucky fella.
Lay off once, would you?
What'd I say?
It's the way you say it, like there's something more too it.
You been wearing rubbers, Billy-Boy?
Wha... ?
Birth control's important.
(blushing, astonished) What... what kinda thing is that to say?
She's right.  If you two are doing the horizontal polka, the last thing you want is a thirty-five pound bundle-of-joy stumbling around, knocking over furniture and calling you "daddy."
(beleaguered) Jeez... it's too early in the morning for this.  Leave off. (hands up newspaper) Here's your paper.
What, am I supposed to read it while I drive?  Keep a grip on it, alright?
(turns to Billy-Boy) You know, the more weight back there, the faster the car goes.
Bullshit.
You never heard of physics, Einstein? The laws of physics.  The more ballast we keep closer to the rear tires...
I'm back here, aren't I?  So, you don't have to make up a buncha lies to make me feel good about it.
Oh... okay.
Nena faces front.

The Torino comes to halt at a seedy "ADULT BOOK SHOP." "Live Nude Girls."  Our heroes pile out of the car. Billy-Boy and Nena head in, but Kittle stops, incensed by GEORGE WASHINGTON MANNEQUIN with an inflatable SEX-DOLL i its arms.  A sign above reads "Porn on the Fourth of July Kittle shoves the mannequin to the ground, then follows..
Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle move briskly thru.  The PORN DEALER at the counter leaps to his feet, fearful.
Hey, hey, hey, Kittle... I don't need no fucking hassle here!
(pointing, furious) Then, sit your fat, sweaty ass back down in that chair!
Porn Dealer obeys.
Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle push through beaded curtains i a dank hall.  They split up, opening doors, searching...
(in thru a door) Pardon me... my mistake.  Taking your thoughts in hand, huh... ?
(into a booth) Whoops... don't mind me.  Go ahead and finish up.
A greasy, bespectacled pervert, BENNY, sits in a tiny boo sweating in front of a window looking in on a top-less STRIPPER who gyrates without enthusiasm. A KNOCK, and Kittle sticks his head in.
Sir, the management would like to offer a complimentary wet-nap...
Benny turns, mortified.
Hey, Benny!  How's it hanging? Well... you know, don't answer that.
Kittle WHISTLES down the hall, then enters, friendly.
Kittle...
Where you been hiding, grease-fist? We've been looking for you.
Nena and Billy-B cram in, shut the door.  Very tight fit.
You remember Nena and Billy-Boy. (BANGS on window) Take a break, sweetheart.
The stripper goes to sit in a chair.
What do you want?  I'm clean.  I been clean a long time.
Really?  Is that a fact... ?
Kittle puts his gun to Benny's forehead, searches Benny's pockets, finding a bag of powder, which he hands over his shoulder to Nena.  Nena sticks in her pinkie, tastes it.
Pure horse.
(reholsters gun) You are such a disappointment, Benny.
Nena sprinkles the powder to the floor
Oh, you fuckers!  You fucking fuckers!  What?  What do you want?

Word is, while the vice cops on the East Coast were standing around playing pocket pool, 300 kilos of heroin got smuggled into New York City.  And, right now it's making a cross-country journey to Hollywood,
Arriving tonight
Going into Zimmermann's pipeline.
Look, I know how you guys operate, but I got a witness... (points to glass) I got a witness, so you can't squeeze me.
The bored stripper smokes a cigarette, and just then a ME DOOR SLIDES CLOSED over the window.  Peep show's over.
(grins) Looks like your dime ran out.
Kittle motions to Billy-Boy.  Billy-Boy squeezes past, li Benny by the lapels and shakes him violently.
Hey now... what the fuck... ?
Again.
Billy-Boy shakes Benny harder, really rattling him.
Know what he's doing, Benny?  He's trying to jog your memory.
I don't know what you're talking about, man.  Even if I did, I'm not so crazy I'm gonna cross Zimmermann.

This scag is enough to keep every junkie from here to the Mexican border high as a kite for the next two years.  You think we're gonna let Zimmermann haul it onto our streets on the Fourth-of-fucking-July!?
You must not think we take our responsibilities very seriously.
Billy-Boy shakes Benny, and shakes him and shakes him...
Last time Billy-Boy did this, the guy's neck broke... (SNAPS fingers) ... just like that.  Sad in a way. Why is it we don't truly appreciate our arms and legs till we've lost the use of them?
Alright!  Alright... put me down...
Billy-Boy looks to Kittle,  Kittle nods.  Billy-Boy puts Benny down.  Nena cozies up, starts combing Benny's hair over his bald spot, which is creeping him out.
It's bone dry out there.  Everybody's hurting.  The stuff floating around's been cut so many times it's like powdered sugar, but Zimnermann's gonna fix it.
I need the "when" and the "where."
I don't know, okay?  All I know is Butch Cassidy's back in town.
That's not what we heard.
He's back, swear to friggin' God.  I seen him at the needle farm saying how he's Zimmermann's number one candy-man again.  If anyone knows anything, he does.
Airight... we'll take that.  But, start spreading the news... (pokes Benny's chest) Zimmermann goes down tonight.
Nena and Billy-Boy exit.  Benny's relieved.  Kittle stops and tosses a handful of coins on the floor...
Knock yourself out.
Kittle throws in a handkerchief, slams the door.
Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle get in the Torino.  They drive
Kittle Sorts thru 8-track tapes on the dash.  He puts one into the player and twists volume.

Springsteen's "BORN TO RUN" (or some similar 70's anthem cause all our hearts to skip a beat with cheap, easy, sentimental reminiscence) is HEARD KICKING IN... CAMERA FOLLOWS the Torino. TRACKING SHOT: of the stars on the dirty sidewalks of Hollywood Boulevard whizzing by. TRACKING SHOT: past a STREET VENDOR with a cart of flags, election buttons and dozens of R,W+B inflatable animals. WHIP PAN: to follow the Torino as it races past, then ZOOM IN: on the neon lettering of the "FROLIC ROOM" bar. TRACKING SHOT: past an x-rated theater double-billing "Al in Wonderland" and "Behind the Green Door." TRACKING SHOT: past a shop window of televisions all show Prez Ford speechifying. The Torino turns, cutting across a trash strewn lot. CAMERA FOLLOWS the Torino as it comes out to the street, the MUSIC spiriting us thru this montage abruptly goes GARBLED and SLOWS to an EXTENDED GROAN...
Kittle looks down, pissed.
What the fuck... ?
He yanks the 8-track cassette.  The player spits ragged tape.  It's screwed.
Torino's parked.  Nena looks through binoculars...
Come on, Butch... show your pretty face...
Scanning curtained windows of a shit-hole MOTEL in bleak suburbs.  Various freaks and prostitutes hang out. Man-oh-man, this place is one hell of a skeeze-pad.
Just breathing the air in there'll give you the clap.
Kittle's still yanking tape from the cassette player, tossing it out.  Billy-Boy's smoking in back.
You shouldn't litter.
Thank you, concerned citizen.
Give a Hoot.  Don't Pollute.
I'll give you a fucking hoot if you don't shut up back there.

Kittle turns on the RADIO: "Afternoon Delight" by Starlig Vocal Band.  He pushes another button: "Saturday Night" b the Bay City Rollers. Billy-Boy takes a swig from his pocket flask, snuffs his cigarette in an overflowing ashtray. Kittle tries other stations, frustration growing as the choices worsen: "Disco Duck" by Rick Dees.  "Popcorn." "Seasons in the Sun" by Terry Jacks.  Glen Campbell's "Rhinestone Cowboy."  "Don't Give Up On Us" by David Soul
Don't torture yourself...

She turns the RADIO OFF, hands binoculars to Kittle and opens the newspaper.  Headline: ISRAELI COMMANDOS FREE HOSTAGES.  She pulls out a section, tossing it to Billy.. The funny pages.  Billy-Boy starts reading them. Nena folds the paper over to the "HOROSCOPE."
Why do you bother with that mumbo-jumbo crap?  Some fruitcake's writing it between bong hits, making it up as he goes, and you're actually taking the time to read it.
Yeah, non-believer?  Here's yours... (reading) "Scorpio, October 24 to November 22: Jupiter is in conflict with Saturn, so proceed with caution..."
Look out!  Jupiter and Saturn'll get you every fucking time.
"Today you have a rare opportunity to make a big difference in your chosen field.  By your able leadership and with great conviction and strength of character, you will come up a winner."
Let me see that... (reads, impressed) Not bad.
Kittle's pleased, looking back thru the binoculars.
What's mine say?

(reading, to Billy) "Leo.  The stages of the moon are in alignment, so now is a perfect time for a vigorous regimen of self improvement.  Wash yourself more carefully each morning, stop using pies and cakes as your primary source of nourishment, and quit tucking your shirttails inside your underwear."
It doesn't say that.
No, but it should.
Kittle lowers the binoculars, searching his pockets.
Hey, before I forget...
He hands over two small boxes, wearing his sincerity on h sleeve.  Billy-Boy and Nena open the boxes, finding brigh R,W+B "Spirit of '76" SALT AND PEPPER SHAKERS.
(pridefully modest) Just a little, you know... Bicentennial memento.  Nothing special.
Whoa, thanks, man.  These are cool. They'll be collector's items.
(unenthused) Yeah... great.
You know... you could say thank you.
You're the one with the star-spangled hard-on, not me.
What are you, communist?  At least numb-nuts here has the courtesy to pretend he likes them.
Kittle looks back through binoculars.
Hey...
Forgive me for not ooing cartwheels over commemorative salt and pepper shakers

I just think you should show some respect.  I mean, call me old fashioned, but 200 years ago when Ben Franklin and those guys signed the Constitution and Declaration of Independence, they did that so we could all share in the freedom...
First of all, the Constitution wasn't writtem till 1787...
You know what I mean.
Second of all, the Declaration of Independence was all for liberty and equality, but it didn't do anything about slavery, did it?
(stymied) Yeah, well... nobody's perfect.  They couldn't go doing everything at once.
All I'm saying is, your little Bicentennial mementos would be more accurate if there were no holes in the pepper shaker so the pepper couldn't get out.
Let's drop it, alright?
Sure.
Alright?
Absolutely.
Kittle looks back through binoculars.

A hairy nan in only shorts gets a paper from a coin box. a balcony, a door opens... someone's coming out... ZOOM IN: on BUTCH CASSIDY, a sorry-looking transvestite hustler in blonde wig, smeared lipstick and cowboy hat. Butch Cassidy rides again.
Kittle lowers binoculars.  Billy-Boy sits forward.
That's him alright.
It's go time, Billy-B.
Billy-Boy climbs out, brings a GOLF CLUB as a weapon.
Escort everyone's favorite She-Male over here nice and peaceful-like. Let's not have another incident like at the laundromat.  I'll never forget the look on that poor woman's face.
That wasn't my fault.
Save it.  Just go.

Billy-Boy treks toward the motel. Up the block, Butch Cassidy greets other hookers in front the motel, slaps "five." Billy-Boy crosses the street, hides the club behind him. Ahead, a CUSTOMIZED VAN with a Spiderman mural painted on the side pulls up, stops across the street from the motel
Kittle frowns.
Billy-Boy picks up the pace.  Ahead, Butch Cassidy seems notice him, tries to act casual, heading to the street.
(under his breath) Don't let him get to the van.
Butch is going towards the van.  Billy-Boy starts run-walking, far from inconspicuous.
Kittle grips the steering wheel.
Don't let him get to the van.
Butch Cassidy looks to Billy-Boy, runs.  Billy-Boy sprint
Kittle leans out, shouting.
Don't let him get to the fucking van!

Butch Cassidy jumps in the van as it does a screaming u-turn.  Billy-Boy throws his golf club in frustration. Kittle starts the Torino and peels out just as the van ra past in the other direction. Billy-Boy runs back.  The Torino heads towards him, spins Nena throws open the door...
Billy-Boy scrambles in back.
Smooth move, hot-shot.
What was I supposed to do?
Lose some weight.
The Torino roars forward.  The van's got a good lead.
Kittle hits the SIREN.  Nena mounts the spinning DOME LIG In back, Billy-Boy grips half his seatbelt.
I... I can't find my seatbelt.
What do you want me to do about it?
The van zooms through an intersection, dipping hard.  A f beats later, the Torino follows, bouncing...
Billy-Boy's head SLAMS roof.  He yelps, gripping his skul
FOLLOW the high speed pursuit... Jerking corners. The van burns a 4-way stop.  A VW Bug starts to cross...
Billy-Boy's looking down as he fastens his seatbelt. Nena points at the VW...
Look out!
Kittle hits brakes...
The Torino stops, inches from the Bug.
Billy-Boy lurches, hitting his face on the seat in front him and rebounding.  He clutches his forehead.
Stop that!
Kittle pounds the horn.  Nena's yelling.  The Bug moves.
Go, go, go!
Kittle zooms around.

The van takes a corner, careening off a parked car... The van races on.  However, ahead... A car backs out of a driveway, blocking the street. The van brakes hard, throwing smoke, HORN BLARING. Behind, the Torino rounds the corner...
We got him.
Slow down.
"Go, go, go!"  "Slow down."  Make up your mind.
Don't crowd him.
The Torino closes in.  The van's rear doors open... ZOOM IN: a tie-dyed HIPPY in the van leveling a SHOTGUN.. In the Torino, Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy see him...
Down!
Kittle, Mama and Billy-Boy duck as the Torino brakes. The hippy BLASTS... A hole EXPLODES in the Torino's windshield. The Torino stops.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy sit up.
Hate to say I told you so.

The van's reverse lights come on, tires spinning... Kittle reacts, puts the Torino in reverse... The van picks up speed, doors jerking closed, chasing the Torino backwards down the block... Nena kicks hard -- jettisons the ruined windshield.
The VAN DRIVER uses the side rearview to see.  Butch Cassidy, in the passenger seat, looks to the back where t Hippy's kneeled on a WATERBED and reloading.
What the fuck you doin'?  They're pigs!  You can't kill no cops!
Watch me.

Kittle's going full speed reverse.  Nena FIRES her gun in the back of the van. Other cars brake as the Torino rockets backwards thru an intersection.  The van arrives similarly, sliding... The van burns rubber, chooses another street, forward.
Nena reloads with a speed loader.  Kittle shifts gear, blasting onwards to follow.
Sons of bitches!
We catch 'em, I wanna be first to hurt 'em.  Promise me I get to go first.
We'll share.

The van hits the road's crest, airborne... Lands hard, heading downhill, south into a canyon. The Torino follows, flying... bottoming out. The road twists radically.  Kittle brings the Torino close... nudges the van's rear. The van SCRAPES guardrail, throws sparks, straightens.
Wind whips thru the car.  Nena gets onto the hood, halfwa out, biting her lip and aiming two guns,
Hold your horses, sweetpea.  We need Butch Cassidy alive, remember?
Shit.  You're right.
Nena considers, disappointed.
If they crash, maybe he'll run.  You can shoot him in the leg or something.
Let's hope.

The van and Torino barrel downhill, barely controlled. Opposing traffic zips past. Kittle rams from behind again.  The van's doors open... The Hippy tries to aim, shifting to and fro. The Torino backs off.
Butch Cassidy gets out of his seat, moves back...
You crazy fucking junkie!
Butch KICKS the Hippy from behind...
The Hippy hits the street, rolls... Screaming as... The Torino's grillwork rushes to meet him.
The car BOUNCES -- BUMPITY-THUD -- as the Hippy is crushe Billy-Boy looks back as the body disappears around a bend
Ouch.
Billy-Boy unhooks the POLICE RADIO microphone beside him.
(into mic) Central, car 1-5-5 requests an ambulance (looks back) Uh... ambulance emergency at Canyon Boulevard and...
He tries to spot a cross street.
(into mic, at a loss) Um... we're on Canyon where it's really... twisty, turny.
FOLLOW the van and Torino.  The road's curves are extreme It's all the Torino can do to stay close. Taking a turn wide, the van DECIMATES mailboxes. The Torino follows through fluttering letters.
That's a federal offense right there; tampering with the U.S  mail!
Kittle girds his loins, eyeing the opposite lane.
I'm gonna get beside him.
(worried) No you're not.
(equally fearful) That's a bad plan.
Kittle loosens his tie.
I'm gonna get beside.  Nena, you're gonna shoot out his tires.
No, we are not going to do that.
Kittle accelerates.  ENGINE ROARS...

The Torino inches into the opposite lane, is forced to retreat because of oncoming traffic. The Torino tries again, but a pick-up truck's coming... Misses by inches, side mirror SMASHED!  Kittle recoils.
(determined) I can work this.
No you can't.
Get ready.
I hate you.
Brief straightaway.  Kittle speeds up... The Torino comes along the van's left side... Nena puts her guns out, aiming for tire... AHEAD:  a motorcycle speeding straight at the Torino!
Kittle's eyes widen. Nena sees the cycle. Kittle jerks the wheel left. Nena pulls her arms in just as...
The motorcycle somehow fits between the van and Torino. The Torino returns to its proper lane behind the van.
Nena looks at Kittle, seething.  Kittle won't look at her
You... SUCK!  You almost got us all killed!
You think this is so easy?
Can't be worse than you.
Oh yeah?
That's right, white bread.  Give it up.  Right now.
Okay, okay... hold on.  Don't go getting your panties in a knot...
Kittle peers forward, THRU WINDSHIELD: pretty straight ro
Make a hole, Billy-Boy.
I'd rather you guys didn't do this again.
Move it!
Billy-Boy reluctantly slides behind Nena as she reaches t hold the wheel...
Go!
Simultaneously: Kittle scrambles over the front seat to t back and Nena hops into the driver's seat.
Now we're taking a ride.
She shifts, ENGINE GROWLING.

Store fronts and businesses.  The van takes a corner, dod other cars... The Torino pursues, Nena at the wheel. The van faces a mini-traffic jam.  Nowhere to go, except. Up on the sidewalk, CLOBBERING a parking meter. Nena follows without hesitation, jumps the curb. On the sidewalk, PEDESTRIANS scatter, screaming. The van BLASTS through the obligatory NEWSSTAND... Up ahead: FRUIT STAND... DESTROYED... The van hits the cross street... BOUNCES over a median strip, burning rubber.  The Torino's behind, HORN BLOWING Civilian vehicles panic skid, CRASHING parked cars, The upcoming intersection shows a red light.  Too bad.  T van SLAMS a crossing car, exploding onward.
Kittle climbs up to the front passenger seat.
Get closer!  Don't lose him!
I kinda already figured that, but keep those helpful hints coming.
The van takes a sharp turn, tooling up a HIGHWAY ON-RAMP.
... onto the freeway.  Relatively clear sailing ahead.
Butch Cassidy looks in his rearview. THROUGH MIRROR: the Torino rises on the horizon.
It's all R.P.M.'s here.  80mph... 85mph and climbing. The Torino's closing the gap.
Butch Cassidy climbs across the waterbed, opening a utili box by the wheel-well... finds the van's JACK.
The Torino zig-zags past other cars.
The world outside's a blur.
(motions with hands) You put your bumper just behind his left tire and then accelerate... make him spin out...
Is there nothing in this world you enjoy more than the sound of your own voice?
In back, Billy-Boy's looking out, sweaty scared.
(to himself) This is too fast. (to Kittle and Nena) This is way too fast!
Relax.
(grips Kittle's shoulder) We should slow down.
Hands off the suit, monkey-boy. Close your eyes if you're scared.
Billy-Boy sits back, digs up his "Pittsburgh Steelers" football helmet and straps it on.
The van and Torino blast past.

Butch Cassidy's at the head of the waterbed with the jack rigged under the frame, pumping the handle... The frame lifts in front; angled so the waterbed's slidin and sloshing... bunching up at the rear doors.
The Torino increases velocity.
Butch Cassidy locks the jack, climbs over the frame and slides down, stomping on the blob-like waterbed. He grips a strap on the ceiling and kicks at the rear doo handle, but misses.  Kicks again.
The Torino's directly behind.  The van's doors open...
Nena, Kittle and Billy-Boy see what's about to happen.
Oh shit!
The waterbed flops out on tbe road... The Torino COLLIDES in an EXPLOSION OF WATER... Spins out of control... Skids backwards on the shoulder, scraping the guardwall t it finally comes to a halt.
Dazed pause.  Nena, Kittle and Billy-Boy are drenched.
Alright... you had your chance, sister.  Make room for Kittle...
Nena climbs in back.  Kittle takes the wheel.
The Torino spits shoulder gravel, u-turning... causing ot cars to make drastic moves to avoid.
Kittle accelerates, shifting gear, focused.
The time has come... (shifts gear) ... for asses to be kicked.
He shifts again.  ENGINE DEAFENING... SPEEDOMETER: 65mph... 70mph... 75mph...
FAR AHEAD: the van.  Butch Cassidy sticks his head out th window, holds his hat, looking back.
Fuck me...
Indeed.  The Torino's far back, but coming on strong.
Firepower, Billy-Boy

Billy-Boy swigs from his flask.  He opens a trap door in seat beside him, reaching back in the trunk to produce a sawed-off shotgun, which he hands up to Nena. SPEEDOMETER: vibrating at 99mph... 105mph...
The Torino's getting close to the van, looks like it's go pass on the right.  The van moves to block... Kittle twists the wheel... Coming around the van's left side...

Nena points the shotgun... The Torino overtakes the van... Nena fires -- BOOM -- the van's back tire is OBLITERATED! The van fishtails, out of control... The van crosses six lanes left, then crosses right back, straight at the concrete GUARDWALL... CRASHES into the guardwall -- the van driver flies throug the windshield like a human cannonball, thrown off the elevated highway...

A TRUCK DRIVER sits in traffic, whistles a tune. PULL BACK to REVEAL: he's in a GLASS TRUCK loaded down wi great, big, perfect sheets of glass, just as... The van driver soars from above -- SHATTERING EVERYTHING!
The Torino skids to halt on the shoulder. Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy run back to look down to where people gather around the glass accident.
Jiminy Christmas.
I can not even begin to imagine how much that must have hurt.
At the van, a door opens and Butch Cassidy stumbles out, askew, bleeding.  He runs across the highway...
(sees Butch) You got to be kidding.
Nena whips out a gun, FIRES a warning shot.
Halt, jackass!
Butch keeps going.  Nema takes quick aim, SHOOTS... Butch's leg is knocked out from under him.  He hits the median, moaning.  Cars rush past.
(to Nena) Told you you'd get to shoot him. (heads to car, to Billy-Boy) Think you can pick him up without all the bells and whistles this time, Big-Boy?  Thanks.
The wounded Torino rides up at the precinct house. At the underground garage, JOE MECHANIC, in greasy overal jaws with cops.  He spots the Torino coming.
Ah, Jeez, here we go again...
Sorry, Joe.  These things happen.
Kittle gets out.  Nena and Billy-Boy drag out the battere Butch Cassidy in a gag and handcuffs.
(tosses keys) Pop in a windshield and bang out the dents.  I need it quick.
(gets in Torino) This car loves you, Kittle.  Why do you treat it so bad?
Fear of commitment.

Joe drives the Torino into the underground garage. Billy-Boy and Nena bring Butch Cassidy up the precinct ho stairs.  Kittle follows,  Cops come and go.  FRIEND COP comes out, a young, fresh-faced model citizen in uniform.
Kittle!?
Kittle's elated to see Friend Cop, bear-hugging him.
Hey, squirt!  Goddamn, it's good to see you.  How you been?
Can't complain, but I will if you give me half a chance.
You met my partners... ? (to Nena and Billy-B) This here's Harry McDoogle's kid. Fresh out of the academy.  Top of the class and best scores on the pistol range to boot.
Billy-Boy and Nena greet him and shake hands.  Meanwhile.
A CADILLAC Eldorado rounds the corner.  TWO VILLAINS in front.  ONE VILLAIN in back.  All in suits and ski-masks.
(positively beaming) Your pop must be proud of you.  Look at ya, ya short-shaver...
Kittle takes off Friend Cop's hat, ruffles his crew-cut.
Finally got a haircut.  Hell, you look almost respectable.
(laughing) Almost, right? (of Butch Cassidy) Looks like you got your hands full.
Buckaroo's going downstairs for a little "chit-chat."  Gonna tell us all about Zimmermann's big score... (removes Butch's gag) Aren't you, Butch-Butch?
Suck my dick.
(stuffs gag back) He's disgruntled right now, but he'll come around.
The Cadillac speeds up... SPLIT-SCREEN:

Nena sees danger, shouts           MACHINE GUNS point fro a warning...                                the windows o Friend Cop spots the                  The Ski-masked VILL Cadillac and starts to                open fire -- flame draw his gun...                          from their weapo Billy-Boy dives forward...         and BLASTING and BLAST Butch Cassidy's hit... blood exploding from his           VILLAINS keep FIRING, body and splattering...            bared through their ma Billy-Boy tackles Kittle...        Machine guns retorting Nena hits the dirt.                   gun barrels spittin Friend Cop's gun is only           BLASTING... halfway up when bullets            BLASTING... slap him in the chest and          BLASTING... BLOOD spurts!  (Straight-          BLASTING... from-the-bucket red paint          BLASTING... blood, like all 70's blood.)

Billy-Boy lands on the                BLASTING ceaselessl ground with Kittle in his arms.                                   The Cadillac Butch Cassidy does a dance of death as glass doors            Machine guns are withd behind him SHATTER.                   smoke wafting. SPLIT-SCREEN ENDS as...

Butch Cassidy goes flying thru the precinct doors. Friend Cops falls, coughing blood. Billy-Boy leaps to his feet, enraged... Nena rises to follow... Billy-Boy and Nena draw weapons as they bound down the stairs, chasing the Cadillac, SHOOTING. On the stairs, Kittle sees Friend Cop down.  Horror. Billy-Boy and Nena keep running and FIRING, but... The Cadillac escapes round a corner. Kittle comes to Friend Cop's body, cradles him.
No... come on, kid.  Come on... (feels for pulse) No...
Friend Cop's dead.  Kittle squeezes him, eyes filling wit tears, anguished fury building...
(to the heavens) Noooooooooooo...!!
FOLLOW the Cadillac's escape.  Villains remove ski-masks.

In front, there's MICKEY, evil, with spiked blonde hair a wrap-around sunglasses, and BALLS, eviller, a lip-less dullard in a fez hat and turtle-neck sweater.  In back, there's POE, evilest, one dangerous-looking bastard; a circus freak giant in a pink polyester three-piece suit.
Nice job, boys.  Iced a bonus cop in the bargain.
He dips his gold-plated pinkie-nail in a vial, snorts cok
Groovey.
He grins, has a bunch of teeth missing in front.

Windowless, wood-paneled walls showcase fine oil painting QUIET MUSIC PLAYS.  It's a staid club, isolated from the outside world.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy push thru the front doors, blowing by the MAITRE D'.
Excuse me, sir.
You're excused.
Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy stop, scanning the restaurant. The maitre d' catches up, blocking, calmly superior.
Sirs and madam... I assure you you're not welcome here,  This is a very exclusive, private club.
So is this...

Kittle shows his badge, moving on... Snobby, upper-crusty PATRONS look up with disapproval fro their R,W+B centerpieced tables as our heroes stride to.. The table in the rear corner, where ZIMMERMANN is flanked TWO BIMBOS, Mickey, Balls, Poe and other THUGS.
Well, well... if it isn't the Justice League of America.

Zimmermann is a jewelry-adorned, Truman Capote-ish drug-czar, sinister and calm.  Balls stands, looking toug Billy-Boy picks up speed, SHOVES Balls with both hands... Sends Balls stumbling violently backwards, CRASHING into FLIPPING over another table, to the dismay of patrons.
(to Balls) Don't get up on our account. (to Zimmermann) Mind if we join you, Zimmermann?
Kittle sits.  Thugs are edgy.
Be my guest. (to bimbos) Ladies... go powder your beaks.
The Bimbos go as Nena and Billy-Boy sit.  Balls rises, wiping scrambled eggs off his suit, furious.  Zimmermann waves him off, and Balls acquiesces, skulking away.
How you been, Poe?
Better than ever, chickie.
Still haven't fixed those front choppers, huh?  Guess you're digging that hillbilly look.
We probably should give 'em back... but Billy-Boy seems to think they're some kinda good luck charm.
Billy-Boy holds up a tiny jar with teeth inside, rattles them at Poe.  Poe remains impassive.
(still eatimg) What can we do for you, officers? What new, mindless harassments have you planned this morning?
Just wanted to make you aware... before today's over, we'll be standing on top of your mountain of horse and pissing down on you.
Thank you for sharing that charming image.
Laugh it up.  You'll cry later.
You'll cry like a great big, blubbering baby.
Zimmermann laughs, dabs his mouth with his napkin.

You three... (shakes head, amazed, addresses the table) Narcotics have been around since before 4000 B.C.  Marijuana was a major crop in colonial North America. Wars have been waged over opium, and still... in spite of it... (motions to trio) ... into that timeline of thousands of years come three vice cops determined to change the course of human history.
Thugs laugh derisively.  Kittle struggles to mask anger.
Couldn't have said it better myself.

You bust some small-time pimps, whores and dime-bag junkies, like the world's a better place because you're in it.  And for what, Kittle... two hundred and fifty dollars a week? Tell me, how does anyone get so self-rightious when they can barely afford to pay their rent?
Just 'cause you belong to some fancy-pants club, doesn't make you any less a murderer.
Murderer?  Really?
You're stealing people's lives, pusher-man. You might be killin' them so slow they think they're being saved, but down that road, they're just as dead.
Live under whichever delusion you choose, you'll never touch me. You're not smart enough.
Shove it up your ass.
And always with the witty rejoinder. Touche'! (picks up menu) Let me treat you to brunch.  You'll need your strength.
Thanks, but we don't recognize "brunch" as an actual meal.

(looking at menu) I insist.  What will it be?  Boston Tea Party Clam Chowder, or maybe the Chicken Red, White and Cordon Bleu? No... (tosses menu) There's a special on the menu, today only... (pointedly, to Kittle) ... roasted pig.
Kittle does a slow boil...
Friend Cop's gun is only halfway up when bullets slap him the chest and BLOOD spurts... !

head_text.subj: BACK TO SCENE IN POSE CLUB

text: All at once, IN SLOW MOTION: Kittle stands, enraged, pulling his gun... Poe pulls his gun... Nena shoves her hands in her overcoat pockets... Billy-Boy reaches both hands cross-armed into his jacket. Kittle levels his gun at Zimmermann. Poe puts his gun to Kittle's temple. Billy-Boy points two guns at Mickey just as Mickey raises his gun and puts it in Billy-Boy's face. Nena brings her hands thru pocket holes, shrugging her co pointing two sawed-off shotguns on shoulder straps. Several thugs freeze, eye-to-eye with Nena's shotguns. END SLO-MO.  Stalemate.  Waiters and patrons freak, clear out, screaming.  The eye of the storm:
I could end a whole lotta suffering right now.
And your friends' lives.

Zimmermann calmly stares down Kittle's gun, brings a fork of meat to his south and chews.  Kittle wants to pull the trigger so badly, shaking, sweat dripping down his face. But, Kittle reins his anger in...  backs off.
Your poison's not gonna make it into the veins of any kids this time.
Wave that flag, hero.  Keep dreaming those dreams.
Kittle leads Nena and Billy-Boy out, past frightened employees.  Thugs return to their seats. SLOW ZOOM IN: as Zimmermann allows an edge of anger.
Something needs to be done about them, once and for all.

The precinct's busy with cops and jabbering weirdoes in custody.   Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy move thru the boarded-over front doors, crossing... All around, other cops are giving dirty looks to our trio Near the duty desk, OFFICER STEVE, a square-jawed uniform cop, nudges his intense, crew-cut partner, OFFICER JIM. These are blue-blooded, boots-polished, buttons-shined co Officer Steve points out Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy.
(with disdain) Whoop-de-do, there they go. Strutting in like they're better than us.
They're a disgrace.
It's their kind of... of... overzealous antics that give cops a bad name.

Officer Steve nods in full agreement. Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy near double doors.  A grumpy-looking plain-clothes HOMICIDE COP is heading the opposite direction, chomping on a peanut-butter and jelly sandwich.  His eyes light up when he spots Billy-Boy.
(mouth full, to Billy) Hey, big man... how's the last of the red hot lovers?
Billy-Boy's confused.  Homicide Cop's jolly, like they're on a private joke.  Problem is, Billy-Boy's not in on it.
(off Billy-B's confusion) That girlie of yours... she's one-in-a-million, I'll tell you.  How you lucked into that, I'll never know.  You must be one gifted cocksman.
I don't... what... !??
But, Homicide Cop's beading on, winking and clicking his tongue in lascivious appreciation.  Billy-Boy hasn't a cl moving to keep up with Nena and Kittle.
A stereotypically busy room of overburdened bulletin boar and file cabinets.  As Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy enter, WHIP PAN: to middle-aged CAPT. ALBERT, who points angrily
My office!  Now!
Captain Albert slams the door, circles Kittle, Nena and Billy-B as they sit.  The graying DISTRICT ATTORNEY RAVIC stands with arms crossed, looking out the window.

I turned on my t.v., and I expected to see Los Angeles brimming with jubilation.  I expected children with painted faces.  Men and women in Bicentennial garb.  Multi-ethnic marching bands.  Pie eating contests. All good things American. I turned on my t.v., and what did I see instead? (turns to cops) A corpse was scraped off Canyon Road after Lord knows how many cars ran over the carcass.  And in a related story, a high speed chase ended when the suspect was thrown from the highway to his death.
Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy exchange looks, a bit sheepish
And, what... what am I forgetting? Oh, yes... the transvestite junkie whose bullet riddled body came blasting through the front doors of the precinct house!
Well, sir...
No.  Don't open your mouth!  You honestly think you can explain this to my satisfaction?
I... I think I can... clarify...
Don't bother.  This behavior's gone on too long.  You're suspended.
What?
You heard the man...
Captain Albert points at a CLOCK.  12 noon.
It's noon straight up.  Effective immediately, you three work desk jobs till midnight.
You can't be serious.
Can't I?
We've been chasing this deal six months, and now you're gonna chuck it out the window?
SLOW ZOOM IN: on Kittle as he stands up.

Hey now, look!  Let's all get on the same page here.  This shipment is do or die for Zimmermann's syndicate; all or nothing.  If we stop the drugs, we don't even have to catch him red-handed.  He's ruined cause his pushers go broke with nothing to sell.  On the other hand, if we fuck this up, it means more zombies crawling the gutters than ever and a morgue that doesn't have a single empty drawer.  More old ladies getting mugged and molested by junk-hungry needle-freaks, and all the while Zimmermann's sitting back and laughing his head off.
There'll be other chances.
Not like this.  Are you even listening?
I will not allow your obsession to turn a day of pride and celebration into a day of wholesale slaughter.
(rising) May I say something... ?
No!
Billy-Boy sits back down.  Kittle's fed up.
Don't you condescend to tell me how or why to honor Independence Day, and don't tell me I'm overreacting when I'm trying to bust the guy responsible for half the filthy junk coming into this city!
You're about an inch away from insubordination!
Well... seeing how you just suspended me, what's to stop me from calling you a crazy bastard, you old fart?
(bottled fury) Till the last firework fizzles out tonight, detective, you sit a desk. And, after that, I'll decide if you keep your shield.

Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy storm in.  Cops at sinks and urinals look up.  Kittle motions them out. Nena goes to sit on the window ledge, worried, while Billy-Boy checks stalls.  The other cops exit, irritated,
I say, fuck 'em.  Let's go.
Well... we shouldn't rush into this, right?  Let's talk about it.
What are you, Henry friggin' Kissinger all the sudden?
I'm just saying...
You're just saying nothing!  Tonight is the night.
Yeah, but if we don't sit, they'll take our badges.
What of it?  Haven't we waited forever... ? (turns to Nena) Haven't we, honey?  Haven't we waited long enough to get this scumbag?
Nena looks down.  She's having doubts.
What... ?  Not you too?
He's right.  We hit the bricks, we walk back triple-fucked.
I can't believe I'm hearing this,
I worked my ass off for my badge, Kittle,  It's the only thing that makes me different from every other slob out there.
That's not true.
I know it is, even if you don't.
All I got is being a cop.  What do I do if I'm not that?

You big, fat sonofabitch, if it weren't for me, you'd still be sitting in the file room where I found you. (to Nena) And you... Nena... you've still got needle scars from where I pulled you out of.  You of all people...
Yeah, my arms healed up real good, and that's how I wanna keep 'em. That's what I'm trying to tell you.
Guys... all we've got is each other. Don't we know that by now?
Nena stews.  Billy-Boy sweats, stares at the floor.
Christ... (hurt pause) Alright... alright, I'm taking off. I'll expect you to catch up.
He walks.  The door swings closed.  Nena's miserable.
(under her breath) Damn him.

IN THE TORINO, Kittle gets in.  He keys the engine, pause gripping the wheel, contemplating.  It's something we've seen cross Kittle's face till now: uncertainty.  Worry. Kittle faces front and shakes off doubt, cursing himself. He puts the car in gear and peels out.
The Torino va-roooms past...
Kittle broods, turns the RADIO ON.  "Muskrat Love" by Captain and Tennille.  He changes channels, irritated: "Convoy."  "The Streak."  "Welcome Back" by John Sebastia
(disgusted) Come on, come on... !
"The Hustle."  "Run, Joey, Run" by David Geddes.  "Kung F Fighting."  He turns the RADIO OFF, sickened.
The Torino parks.
Kittle gets a bottle of baby powder from the glove compartment.  He takes a section of newspaper.

Kittle walks briskly.  Every flea-ridden business along t way's drumming up business by exhibiting patriotism.  Kit stops, hesitating... backtracks... At the XXX-THEATER, he examines a poster for "DEEP ASS," which shows a half-naked, "Deep Ass" ingenue in blue eye shadow, pig-tails and moist lipstick.
Billy-Boy Sits eating a burger, staring lovey-eyed at his SCHOOL-MARM girlfriend.  The girlfriend's familiar now...
The "school-marm" is the porn star on the poster.  Kittle realizes, saddened.  He KICKS -- SHATTERS the window.  Th THEATER OWNER rushes out.
Hey, you fucking creep.
Kittle shoves his badge in the owners face.  The owner ba off.  Kittle takes the "Deep Ass" poster... He folds it and pockets it as he continues.

Seedy.  DISCO MUSIC THROBS.  Kittle passes through the turnstile.  By the erratic light of a glitter ball, three topless, body-painted women, RED GO-GO DANCER, WHITE GO-G DANCER and BLUE GO-GO DANCER, grind to disco rhythm. Kittle moves, wading thru drunken vermin.  A few BUSINESS MEN dance woozily in the aisle.             At the bar, PINKEYE, a sizable lunatic-thug wearing a knitted macrame tie and brown corduroy leisure suit, watc Kittle cross.  Pinkeye downs his scotch. Kittle moves against one curtained wall, admiring the nearest go-go dancer.  He slips behind the curtain...
Kittle moves quickly down this hall.
Kittle climbs a long staircase.  He takes out the bottle baby powder, sprinkles powder on the top landing. He unfolds his newspaper and places it flat over the powd
Meet POP-SWEET, black super-pimp in lime-green fuzzy jump-suit and feathered fedora. He's on the couch, on the phone, caressing the HOOKER bes him.
(into phone) Get this straight, you jive-ass cocksucker.  Do a number on me and you are between a rock and a hard place.  Dig it, clown?
Pop-Sweet hangs up, grumbling as he crosses the room.
Sucker thinks he can play me for a fool.  I'm a entrepreneur.
You sure are, sugar.
Shut up, bitch.  Don't be Ed McMahonning me every time I open my mouth.
Pop-Sweet sits at his desk.  TWO PROSTITUTES wait there. One buffs his nails.  The other gives a backrub. The door flies open.  It's Kittle, moving forward...
Ah, shit...
Pop-Sweet reaches in a desk drawer... Kittle comes to SLAM the drawer on Pop-Sweet's hand.
Ooooow!... alright, man, ease off...
Kittle lets Pop-Sweet's hand free, removes the drawer and retrieves a pearl-handled gun, which he admires.
You always did have style.
(rubbing his wrist) It's one of a kind.
So are you, Pop-Sweet.  That's why...

A SCREAM of RAGE is HEARD.  Kittle wheels... The Hooker's charging, swinging a straight razor... Kittl lifts the drawer to block, then PUNCHES... The Hooker hits shelves of vases, which crash down on her
Fuck, Kittle... why you got to go doin' that?!
Pop-Sweet goes to the unconscious Hooker, rolls her away favor of broken pottery, which he fingers forlornly.
(of the vase) This shit was Ming.
That's the problem with expensive tastes... the more you got, the more you got to lose.
Kittle sits.  Pop-Sweet rises, studies Kittle.
Where's your pet gorilla and the female Uncle Tom?
(slightly off guard) They're... around.
Yeah?  So, what do you want to ask today that I can't answer?  I'm a busy man.
The way Zimmermann takes such good care of you and this drug-peddling "escort service" of yours, I figure you got the scoop on the pharmaceuticals arriving tonight.
(deep sigh, nods) Well, let me tell you how it is...
Pop-Sweet bolts, out the door,  Kittle stands, in no hurr
Pop-Sweet runs down the hall, heading for stairs.  He hit the newspaper and baby powder, slipping, flying... TUMBLES painfully down the stairwell... Hits bottom and lays there, screaming.
... son of a bitch... broke my fucking arm...
Kittle strolls to catch up, starts downstairs.
I'm gonna cut off your flippin' head and use it for a candy dish...
Kittle steps on Pop-sweet's cbest, leans in close.
Talk like that, I might forget to call an ambulance.  Now, tell me again, how's the dope arriving?
A CREAK is HEARD behind.
(realizes) Fuck...
Just as Kittle turns, he's grabbed from behind and thrown He hits a wall and lands in a heap, stunned.
You're the one gonna be needing an ambulance, white boy...

Pinkeye's upon Kittle, stripping him of his gun.  Another brute, LORD CAVIAR, in an open-to-the-belly silk shirt an with jeweled rings on every finger, helps Pop-Sweet up. Kittle tries to get up.  Pinkeye PUNCHES him down.
(to Pinkeye) Outside.
Red Go-Go Dancer shakes her bootie to the DISCO BEAT.

A metal door swings open as Kittle's thrown out into a pi of garbage.  Pinkeye, Lord Caviar and Pop-Sweet follow... SLO-MO: Pinkeye punches Kittle again. SLO-MO: Lord Caviar comes to pistol whip Kittle's head.
White Go-Go Dancer moves her hands across her body, sexy.
SLO-MO:  Kittle's bleeding bad, tries to rise, gets KICKE SLO-MO:  Pop-Sweet, clutching his arm, watches with glee.
Blue Go-Go Dancer's breasts sway as she dances.  She smil

SLO-MO:  Kittle's thrown, clattering thru trash cans. SLO-MO:  Lord Caviar kicks Kittle's ribs. SLO-MO:  Kittle lifts his head, bloody, looking... DOWN THE ALLEY: Nena and Billy-Boy running this way! For a moment, Kittle smiles crooked.  He's saved.
(weakly) ... Nena... Billy...
Pop-Sweet looks down the same alley... It's empty.  Nena and Billy-Boy were Kittle's delusion.
Who you talkin' too, Kittle?
Pop-Sweet whacks Kittle with a backhanded SLAP.
They ain't there, turkey.  You're all by your lonesome!
AERIAL SHOT (FROM ADJACENT ROOFTOP): looking down as the beating continues.   POP-SWEET'S LAUGHTER is HEARD POORLY DUBBED OVER and OUT OF SYNC.

Nena's miserable, wearing big headphones plugged into a "portable" cassette recorder, pulling files, tossing them Into the box on Billy-Boy's lap.  He smokes, staring off, deeply depressed.  Captain Albert arrives to slap his hea
Stop day-dreaming, lard ass.  Where's Kittle?
Nena takes off her headset.
He went to pick up lunch.
Well, shake a leg.  Get these files downstairs... (to Nena) And, quit listening to your fucking voodoo music.
(sarcastic, salutes) Yes, sir.

As the captain moves on, Nena makes her salute into the finger.  She and Billy-Boy share a long look of mutual frustration, then Billy-Boy shuffles away. Nena puts headphones back on, ejects a tape from her recorder and replaces it with another. INT.  PRECINCT, CAPTAIN'S OFFICE -- INTERCUT... Captain Albert sits.  PHONE RINGS.
(into phone) Yeah, what is it? (from phone) Is your telephone etiquette always so sloppy?
Captain Albert tenses, goes to shut his door.
(nervous, into phone) Why the hell are you calling me here?
Beyond a gate topped by an ornate "Z," a pseudo-modern, stucco-nightmare palace sits in H'wood hills. Calmly, captain.  If it weren't important, I wouldn't disturb the fine work you do...
Party preparations.  Men chisel a bald eagle ice sculptur Thugs lounge on Ethan Allen furnishings.  Zimmermann stan with the phone held to his ear by his ENGLISH BUTLER.

(into phone) Your children played with their guns in front of me again today.  This upsets me. (from phone) They've been suspended.  Hell, the do-gooder district attorney came and did it himself.  Thinks he's being a patriot.
Suspending those three is about as useful as giving a speeding ticket to Evil Knievel. I'm keeping an eye on them.
No.  I've had my fill.  I want them taken out of the game. Hello?!  Still on the line? Yeah... I hear...
Captain Albert wipes his sweaty brow.

(into phone) What you're asking... goes against every code of honor... (from phone) Isn't it a bit late to regret lost innocence?  We don't want any indiscreet photographs ending up in the hands of your wife, do we?
Captain Albert agonizes, reddening, trapped.
(pause, into phone) I can... make certain arrangements. But, it'll cost extra.
(into phone) Name your price. (from phone) I want those pictures.  The negatives... everything.
Pluck this thorn from my paw, and you'll have them, with my gratitude. (bitterly) Just the pictures'll be fine, you dirty bastard.
Zimmermann exits, motioning for the butler to hang up. Behind, workmen on ladders unfurl a gigantic American fla from ceiling to floor.  Breathtaking.
A meek music instructor, VINCHENZO, waits with sheet musi under his arm, studying a painting.  Zimmermann strides i his mood brightening,
Vinchenzo... forgive me for letting business trifles distract my attention.  On to more important pursuits, eh?  Come, come... I have a surprise...
Zimmermann ushers the always nervous Vinchenzo forward.
Zimmermann's hands open a medium-sized wooden packing cra
It arrived today.  You won't believe it, even when you see...

They're in a room that's like a bad family-theme-restaura version of a 18th century European music parlor.  Gaudy. Big harp in a corner.  Zimmermann digs thru shredded pape in the crate, removing an old violin case. Vinchenzo is taken aback as Zimmermann opens the case, an gently takes out a beautiful VIOLIN.

(with reverence) Stradivarius.  Antonius Stradivarius of Cremona, post seventeen hundred. One of perhaps five hundred and forty.  Absolutely priceless. (studies it) I was born in Newark, New Jersey, Vinchenzo, as far away from this moment as I think you could ever get. My family lived each day in poverty. I wasn't expected to make anything of myself.  Failure was a given.
May I...
Zimmermann lets Vinchenzo hold the violin,

These hands... (holds his hands up) These are the hands of a grocery clerk... of a janitor, and then a numbers runner who fought and clawed and battled, by hook or by crook, to get his piece of the American dream. These hands were not destined to caress a Stradivarius,  And yet... (takes violin back) The impossible.

Zimmermann picks up his bow off a music stand.  Vinchenzo takes this as his cue, moving obediently to place music o the stand in front of Zimmermann. With a flourish, Zimmermann puts the Stradivarius under h chin, tilts his head, puts the how to the violin strings. pause, and then... Zlmmermann proceeds to play horribly.  Screechy and uneven.  He tries to follow the sheet music, but a child could do better. Vinchenzo attempts to guide by motioning with his hands a body language, cringing a bit, trying to encourage. Zimmermann's frustrated, but keeps playing, vomitously ba biting his tongue in concentration.
In his small, office bathroom, Captain Albert splashes hi face with water.  He stares in the mirror, pale and fearf
Captain Albert returns to his office from the adjoining bathroom.  He goes to a cabinet.  He unlocks a drawer and takes out a paper bag hidden far back.
Billy-Boy topples boxes of files.  He bends to pick up th mess.  Nena enters, eyeing Billy-Boy's ass.  She kicks it
What the... ?!  What was that for?
(walking out) Follow me.
(follows, rubbing ass) How come everyone thinks hitting me's the best way to get my attention?
Nena moves thru, looking around.  Billy-Boy trails.
Where we going?
We have to find Kittle.
Nena ducks behind a squad car.  She gets in and yanks wir under the dash, hot wiring.
Okay.  But, what changed our mind?
(sparking wires) Just keep an eye out till I get this rig up and running.
Billy-Boy rises to keep watch.  His eyes narrow...
Wait a minute... he's back...
